body.title: For whom?
body.question: What are the conditions that make prayer obligatory for a person?

correct.reason: Being Muslim is the first condition.
Being sane is a condition, and insanity excuses one from the obligation.
Reaching puberty is a condition, and praying is not obligatory for children.

wrong.reason: This is not a condition. Every Muslim has to pray, not only the "good" ones.
This is not a condition. Instead, it is the prayer that helps one to stop committing sins.

body.title: Ihsan
body.question: What is the correct way to complete the following sentence: ‘Ihsan is to worship Allah as if you see Him, and if you don’t see Him, ...‘

correct.reason: This is correct! Ihsan is the sincerity and perfection of faith that we should strive for.

wrong.answer: then live your life as you wish.
wrong.reason: Muslims try to live their lives in full submission and obedience to Allah, instead of just following our desires.
Asking Allah's forgiveness for our sins is always a good idea, and He is the Forgiving and Merciful. However, this is not how the sentence ends.

body.title: The visitor's identity
body.question: Who was the visitor and what was the purpose of his visit?

correct.answer: Jibreel came to teach Muslims about our deen (religion).
correct.reason: Correct! Jibreel (peace be upon him) is the archangel who brings revelation to prophets (peace be upon them).

wrong.answer: Mikaeel came to greet the Muslims.
wrong.reason: Mikaeel (peace be upon him) is the angel responsible for weather. It wasn't him visiting though.

wrong.answer: The angel of death  came to converse with the Muslims.
wrong.reason: This angel is responsible for taking souls of people when their time comes. Some narration mention his name as Azrail (peace be upon him). It wasn't him visiting though.

body.title: Pillars of Islam
body.question: What are the five pillars of Islam?
body.hint: The pillars are practices, i.e. actions.

correct.answer: testifying that there is no god but Allah and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah

correct.reason: Prayer (a.k.a. namaz or salah) is the second pillar of Islam obligatory for every Muslim person who reached puberty.
Zakat is the charity obligatory for wealthy Muslims, and is the third pillar of Islam
This is the forth pillar of Islam. In the holy month of Ramadan, Muslims fast during daytime.
Hajj to Makkah is the fifth pillar, and is obligatory for those who have the means to perform it.

wrong.reason: Believing in angels is part of Imaan (true faith). Seeing them is not a must.
Believing in Revealed Books is part of Imaan (true faith). Reading and memorizing the Quran is praiseworthy.
